issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
If MiniDFSCluster constructor throws an exception, the cluster object is not assigned, so shutdown() call not be called on the object.

I saw in a recent Jenkins job where binding error threw an exception, and later on the NPE of cluster.shutdown() hid the real cause of the test failure.

HDFS-9333 has a patch that fixes the bind error.
fields.summary: NPE when MiniDFSCluster#shutdown is invoked on uninitialized reference

comments.body: https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-Hdfs-trunk-Java8/660/testReport/org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.tools/TestDFSZKFailoverController/testManualFailoverWithDFSHAAdmin_2/
Rev01. This fixes the NPE in TestDFSZKFailoverController.
Rev02: Fixed all potential NPEs tearing down test clusters.

This message was automatically generated.

+1 thanks for this improvement [~jojochuang]. When cluster/fs are class members perhaps it also makes sense to set {{cluster = null}} after invoking {{cluster.shutdown()}}, so @After invocations of subsequent test methods don't call shutdown twice on the same object.
Thanks [~arpitagarwal] for the suggestion. Do you intend to say @AfterClass? @Before/@After are run for each test, while @BeforeClass/@AfterClass are run once for the entire test class.
I meant {{@After}}. If a TestCaseB fails to initialize the {{cluster}}, it may see a stale value from a previous TestCaseA when TestCaseB's {{@After}} routine is executed.
Got it! Makes sense to me now.

javac warnings are false positives.

TestJMXGet failures are related to cluster null pointer. The @After method uses a member variable in cluster. I am checking to see if there are more similar cases.
Rev05: reset cluster to null in @Before method; make sure cluster object is not used after resetting to null.

+1

Thanks for the comprehensive patch [~jojochuang]!
I will commit it once Jenkins comes back with results.
